Similar to ‘this is a tricky situation’ from the previous verse, this line refers to the first two tracks of The Miracle, Party and Khassoghi’s Ship, which opens with this line, continuing the theme of the previous track.
They’re only flyin’ too close to the sun

This is a reference to the myth of Icarus in the Greek mythology. Icarus was trying to escape from Crete with wings made out of wax, but he went too close to the sun so his wings melt, he fell and died. This is represented on the single’s artwork.

This may be a reference to a line of another Queen song, It’s A Hard Life from the album The Works (1984).

In It’s A Hard Life, Freddie sings “This is a tricky situation, I’ve only got myself to blame.”
